metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6401 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Jansson, possibly 2.4 and earlier, does not restrict the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a crafted JSON document. Florian Weimer discovered that Jansson incorrectly handled hash collisions predictability. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjansson4 - 2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jansson package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6-1').
